params.text:
• At the airport: arrival & departure formalities
  • Take a cab: tell your destination, pay the fare
  • At the hotel : book a room, check in/out

Social exchanges

The Basics for Business Travel

Language in Action
Social Exchanges: Introduction

Let's go on a business trip!

In this module, you’ll learn how to:

1. Airport: Learn about arriving and leaving the airport.

  2. Taxi: Learn how to take a taxi.

  3. Hotel: Learn how to book and check in/out of a hotel.

dialogs.answer: This is a document you need to travel.
This is a ticket for your flight.
This is your suitcase or bag.
This is where you go to get your boarding pass.
This is where you show your passport and bags when you arrive.
This is where you wait for your flight.

params.textField:
Go to customs after you get your *bags*.
What is your *departure* gate?
Do you have your *boarding* pass?
Please show me your *passport*.
*Where* is your baggage?
Where is the *check-in* desk?

metadata.title: At The Airport – Arrival & Departure - drag the words

params.text: At The Airport – Arrival & Departure Formalities: Forum & Quiz

You are on an online forum where people are talking about airports.
Please read the posts and answer the questions:
Airports can be busy. It's important to arrive early. Don't forget your passport.
Abigail:
Be patient. Security checks can take time. It's better to have too much time than not enough.
Bryan:
Check-in online if you can. It saves time. And don't forget your boarding pass.

params.text: Micah:

dialogs.answer: Use this to tell the driver where you want to go.
Use this to tell the driver to stop.
Use this to ask the driver how much the fare is.
Use this when you give the driver the money.
Use this if you don't want the change back.
Use this to thank the driver.

params.textField:
Can you *take* me to the *hotel*, please?
Keep the *change*, please.
It’s here. *Thank* you.
*Here* you are. Thank you.
How *much* is it, please?
Thank you very much. *Goodbye*.

params.text: Take A Cab: Listening

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.taskDescription: Micah is taking a taxi to the airport. Please listen to her conversation and fill in the missing words:
params.resetDropDescription: Are you sure you want to reset this drop zone?
params.a11yCheck: Check the answers. The responses will be marked as correct, incorrect, or unanswered.
params.a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.
params.a11yRetry: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.
params.textField:
Micah: Can you *take* me to the airport, please?
Taxi driver: Certainly. Where is your *terminal*?
Micah: Terminal 3.
Later
Taxi driver: We're *here*.
Micah: Thank you. How *much* is it?
Taxi driver: That's 20 *dollars*.
Micah: Here you are. Keep the *change*. Thank you.

params.text: Micah is taking a taxi to the airport. Please listen to her conversation and fill in the missing words:

dialogs.text: I would like to book a room.
dialogs.answer:
Use this to ask for a room.
Example: I would like to book a room for two nights.

Use this to ask for a room for one or two people.
Example: I would like a double room, please.

Use this if you have booked a room in advance.
Example: I have a reservation. My name is John Smith.

Use this when you arrive at the hotel.
Example: Good evening. Check-in, please.

Use this when you leave the hotel.
Example: Good morning. Check-out, please.

Use this to ask about the price.
Example: How much is it for one night?

metadata.title: At The Hotel – Book A Room, Check In/Out Interactive Video

params.text: What Do You Say? Quiz

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: You arrive at the hotel and want a room for one night. What do you say?
answers:
I would like to book a room. 

I have a reservation. 

Check-out, please.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: You want to ask how much the hotel room costs. What do you say?
answers:
How much is it? 

I have a reservation.

Check-in, please.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: You want to leave the hotel. What do you say at the reception?
answers:
Check-out, please. 

Check-in, please. 

I would like to book a room.

l10n.a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.
l10n.a11yRetry: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.

params.text: Choose the BEST answer for each question:
Module Summary Quiz
Test your instruction-following skills! Choose the BEST answer for each question to show what you learned in this module.

choices.question: Question 1 of 4: What do you say when you want to ask how much something costs?
answers:
How much is it? 

I would like to book a room. 

Can you repeat that?

choices.question: Question 2 of 4: What do you say when you want to ask for a single room?
answers:
A single room, please.

Check-in, please. 

I have a reservation.

choices.question: Question 3 of 4: How do you tell the taxi driver where to stop?
answers:
Can you take me to...?

It’s not here.

How much is it?

choices.question: Question 4 of 4: What do you say when you arrive at a hotel and have a booking?
answers:
I have a reservation.

I would like to book a room.

Check-out, please.
